Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `initial_engine_hours.value` was last updated. Used to track installation metadata changes and audit trail.
Computation Approach: Backend compares current initial_engine_hours.value with previous

Description: Unit for engine hours value (always "h")
Engine hours reading at time of installation (offset). Measured in hours.
Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `initial_odometer.value` was last updated. Used to track installation metadata changes and audit trail.
Computation Approach: Backend compares current initial_odometer.value with previous

Description: Unit for odometer value (always "km")
Odometer reading at time of installation (offset). Measured in kilometers.
Nominal fuel tank size - `{ value: number, unit: "l" }`
Total engine work time. Unit conversion may be required (some sources in seconds, others in hours).
Computation Approach: (CAN Engine Hours), can_engine_hours_relative, avl_io_449 (Ignition On Counter), avl_io_102 (Engine Worktime)

Description: Total Vehicle Mileage
Computation Approach: (CAN Mileage), can_mileage_relative, avl_io_389 (OBD OEM Total Mileage), obd_custom_odometer, avl_io_105 (Total Mileage (counted)), avl_io_16 (Total Odometer), avl_io_87 (Total Mileage), hw_mileage (Hardware Mileage), raw_mileage (Raw Mileage)

Description: Device internal battery current. Measured in amperes (A).

iButton connection status in immobilizer context. Values: 0 = iButton not connected, 1 = iButton connected (Immobilizer active), 2 = iButton connected (Authorized Driving). Note: Field name is "Immobilizer" but represents iButton authorization state.
MAC address of NMEA receiver device connected via Bluetooth. Usefulness for driver identification is still being evaluated (TBD). May be `null` if not available.
Hardware key identifier as hex string. Can be iButton or RFID code. Backend determines key type based on device model and signal characteristics. Used to lookup driver in Fleeti catalog.
Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `driver.id.value` last changed. Used to show driver-vehicle association timeline and determine which driver was responsible at time of events.
Computation Approach: Backend compares current id.value with previous

Description: Fleeti driver ID from catalog. `null` if hardware key is not found in catalog (unknown driver).
Computation Approach: Lookup hardware_key.value in Fleeti driver catalog

Description: Driver name from catalog. `null` if hardware key is not found in catalog (unknown driver).
Computation Approach: Lookup hardware_key.value in Fleeti driver catalog

Description: Unix Epoch timestamp (milliseconds, number) when `driver.privacy_mode.value` last changed. Used to show "private mode active since X" and separate private vs business time in reports.
Computation Approach: Backend compares current privacy_mode.value with previous

Description: Private mode state. Values: 0 = Private mode off, 1 = Private mode on. Driver setting that indicates whether the driver has activated private/work mode.
Total fuel consumed (cumulative). Measured in liters. Sources include CAN consumption, GPS-calculated fuel used, and counted fuel consumed.
Computation Approach: , can_consumption_relative, avl_io_103 (Fuel Used GPS), avl_io_107 (Fuel Consumed (counted)), avl_io_83 (Fuel Consumed)

Description: Fuel rate
CNG Status
0 Not available 1 Gasoline 2 Methanol 3 Ethanol 4 Diesel 5 LPG 6 CNG 7 Propane 8 Electric 9 Bifuel running Gasoline 1...
Unit for fuel level measurement (% or l)
Fuel level measured by LLS sensor via RS232/RS485
Computation Approach: , can_fuel_litres, avl_io_390 (OBD OEM Fuel Level), obd_custom_fuel_litres, avl_io_201 (LLS 1 Fuel Level), avl_io_203 (LLS 2 Fuel Level), avl_io_210 (LLS 3 Fuel Level), avl_io_212 (LLS 4 Fuel Level), avl_io_234 (CNG Level), avl_io_270 (BLE Fuel Level #1), avl_io_273 (BLE Fuel Level #2), avl_io_84 (Fuel Level), avl_io_89 (Fuel level), ble_lls_level_1 (fuel), ble_lls_level_2 (fuel), fuel_level (Fuel Level), lls_level_1 (LLS Level 1), lls_level_2 (LLS Level 2), lls_level_3 (LLS Level 3), lls_level_4 (LLS Level 4)

Description: Field discovered from JSON structure: sensors.magnet[].id
Field discovered from JSON structure: sensors.magnet[].label
Field discovered from JSON structure: sensors.magnet[].position

Magnetic field sensor readings. Value represents sensor state (typically 0 = no magnetic field detected, 1 = magnetic field detected). Used for door/window position detection or security applications.
Computation Approach: (BLE Magnet Sensor 1), ble_magnet_sensor_2 (BLE Magnet Sensor 2), ble_magnet_sensor_3 (BLE Magnet Sensor 3)

Description: Field discovered from JSON structure: sensors.magnet.value.unit
Field discovered from JSON structure: sensors.magnet.value.value
Ongoing trip information (nullable)
Field discovered from JSON structure: trip.current_location.lat
Field discovered from JSON structure: trip.current_location.lng
Trip Odometer value
Runtime since engine start
Computation Approach: (OBD Engine Runtime), avl_io_42 (Runtime since engine start)

Description: Field discovered from JSON structure: trip.id
Field discovered from JSON structure: trip.start_location.lat
Field discovered from JSON structure: trip.start_location.lng
Field discovered from JSON structure: trip.started_at
